Dear Group

I bought a tsuba from Fred Weissberg that I am looking for information.
Images can be found at
http://www.montanairon.com/images.html

The tsuba is in a turtle or tortoise design.  The tsuba is signed Hoku 
Chikuzen Jo Takakuni.  The only reference
to this smith is in Joly's Shosankenshu, Section "T" number 53, in which 
he notes that Takakuni signed in
tensho (Is this 1573?).  This listing is repeated in Haynes book listing 
H-09281.0.

Does anyone know anything else about this tsuba or smith?

And what type of mounts would this tsuba go with?  
There are many sets of dragon fittings were fuchi/kashira, menuki and 
tsuba all the same.
There are many sets of fittings all in flowers of one type or another.

But what goes with this turtle/tortoise tsuba.  Would you use more 
tutles or some type of water theme?

Thanks for any thoughts.

david
(15 new swords with images listed at my web site)
